settings.title: Popup
settings.content: You can use this popup to display some useful information to your customers.

settings.heading: Coming Soon
settings.newsletter_text:
We're working on something special.

In the mean time please visit us at chromagbikes.com

settings.title: How long will it take to get my order?
What shipping carriers do you use?
Why aren't you open Friday's?
settings.answer: We normally go on a big shop ride every Friday! You're invited!

settings.title: Can I come on the Friday Ride?
settings.answer: Yup! Probably best to swing by HQ or give us a call in the week to find out where we are headed. Plans are subject to change!

settings.title: Do you really have two drum kits in the office?
How many speakers are at the office?
settings.answer: No idea, feel free to come count them.

settings.title: I’m a dealer, who do I talk to about selling Chromag products?
settings.answer: In Canada, NRG. Everywhere else please contact us.

settings.title: Where are you located?
settings.answer: In case you missed our location page,  we're in Whistler BC, Canada.

settings.title: 27.5" or 29"?!
settings.answer:
Sheesh, where to begin!

Some people feel 29ers roll better over rough ground, others feel 650b is more agile and nimble. Gun to our head, most of the staff here ride 29", be it on a hardtail or science bike (full sus). Unless you're dirt jumping in which case 20" or 26" is the best bet!

settings.title: Why Steel?
settings.answer:
We use quality 4130 chromoly steel tubing. Chromoly is an abbreviation for chromium-molybdenum indicating the materials that the steel is alloyed with.

The added chromium helps increase the steels hardenability and also provide some corrosion resistance.
The molybdenum helps to increase the toughness of the steel.

It has a high tensile strength but is also malleable which is what gives our frames their notorious ride quality and feel. Chromoly is often used when more strength is required than that of mild carbon steel.

It falls under the AISI (American Iron & Steel Institute) 41XX designations which is where the “41” comes from. The “30” indicates it contains approximately 0.30% carbon by weight.

Chromoly is much stronger than traditional 1020 steel and it has a higher strength to weight ratio and high tensile strength, which means we can use less material and achieve a product that can withstand the abuse that riders love to throw at it.

Now you know!

settings.title: Are Canadian made frames better than Taiwanese made frames?
Can I pick a custom colour for my frame?
settings.answer: Yes. Canadian made frames are stored raw and waiting to be painted with your custom choice. Taiwanese frames can be re-painted but they need to be stripped first. Please contact us if you are interested.

settings.title: What's the difference between the Stylus and the Wideangle?
settings.answer: Basically the Stylus has thicker burlier tubing, making it more robust.

settings.title: When are you coming out with a science bike (full sus)?!
settings.answer:
Stop asking!!

(Technically we already have one and we use it to take out the recycling)

settings.title: Why is the Surface Ti so expensive?
settings.answer: The clue is in the name. Titanium! This wonderful material comes at a cost, be it the raw material or the cost involved with how difficult it is to weld.

settings.title: Ranger or HiFi stem?
settings.answer: It comes down to personal preference. In terms of strength you're in safe hands with either. It really depends if you like the look of a CNC'd part that is made in Canada, or you'd rather save some cash and get something that's forged overseas.

settings.title: Question not listed?
settings.answer: You can contact us through our contact page! We will be happy to assist you.

settings.title: What do you want!
settings.values: Dealer Inquiries, Custom Paint, Warranty, Sales, Product Info, Careers, Friday Ride, I'm lonely I just want to chat, Other
